Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 22 Oct 2018Yes iFast provides ETFs as well. If your FA uses them as part of your portfolio it would make sense to pay them a wrap fee for it.If you want to DIY, using FSM (their B2C channel) or Interactive Brokers could be cheaper based on your AUM. 0 comments0
